alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area; South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 04 at 11:29AM PDT until November 05 at 1:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: .An atmospheric river will bring heavy rain to the burns scars in the area today and tonight. Around 3 to 4 inches of rain are expected through 11 PM with local amounts up to 5 inches. The heaviest rain is expected this afternoon into early evening. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE NAKIA CREEK, SIOUXON, KALAMA, SUNSET, BLACK HOLE BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Nakia Creek, Siouxon, Kalama, Sunset, Black Hole burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Washington, including the following areas, Greater Vancouver Area, South Washington Cascade Foothills and South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Nakia Creek, Siouxon, Kalama, Sunset, Black Hole burn scar is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Nakia Creek, Siouxon, Kalama, Sunset, Black Hole burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Cascades
